website_summaries.verdict: A three gallon tank with filter that will really provide the best environment for your betta.
pros: Has an easy to operate clear lid
LED lighting hangs over the top of the tank
The three gallon size will give your betta adequate room to grow
cons: Water tends to condense on the lid, and can be messy when you take it off to feed your fish

website_summaries.verdict: A mini-tank for showing off a Betta fish or a couple of goldfish or small tropical fish. A nice choice for a child's room.
pros: Clear plastic 3-gallon tank resists shattering and cracks
Includes a pedestal base, Whisper filter and accessories, and LED light fixture
Add decorations, gravel, heater, water conditioner, and fish
cons: Only large enough for a couple of fish
Several owners felt the filter was not powerful enough to cycle the water

customer_reviews.title: He is more than happy with the amount of space
customer_reviews.text: Got $25 giftcard from work. Put black sand and blue jewels with a pagoda piece and some live grass and got a red crescent moon beta fish. He is more than happy with the amount of space. This is the tank people should be putting their betas in not those 0.5gal death boxes. The flow system and intake have not caused any issues. Its actually light enough that a film is on the water surface.
customer_reviews.author: Deshan de Silva

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous To Half Moon Betas
customer_reviews.text: We have a gorgeous half moon beta and wanted a better tank for him to show off his beauty. After we read the reviews on this tank, we decided to purchase this tank to show off his beauty. After putting the tank together and refilling it with conditioned water, we put our beta in his new home. When he went near the bottom of the filter, he was sucked into the pump and it shredded his fins. We are not sure if he will make it. As you can see by the first picture, he is gorgeous! The second and third pictures are after the pump got him.
customer_reviews.author: GLF

customer_reviews.title: Two thumbs up!
customer_reviews.text: Has worked great for us! Easy to set up and waters stays clear, I've used regular sponges as filters and they worked best/lasted longer the traditional filters.
customer_reviews.author: Javier

customer_reviews.title: Faulty Product
customer_reviews.text: I've had this tank for a little less than a month and it started leaking today. Haven't handled it roughly at all, I don't even move the tank when I do my water changes. Good thing I caught the leak early in the morning or else by the time I got home from work, my fish probably would have been dead. The tank is made of plastic so I guess I should have expected something like this to happen. Will be using glass tanks from now on. Don't get this because it's the cheaper option. Not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This tank is beautiful!
customer_reviews.text: Did lots of research to replace my daughter's current tank ... and couldn't be happier with this one! The pedestal is really unique and showcases the tank. The light is bright and makes the tank look crystal clear. Her betta seemed to enjoy it right away. We hadn't had a filter previously because I kept reading that bettas get sucked into them, but after months of cloudy, dirty water that needed to be completely changed weekly, we needed a better solution. This filter is quiet, the suction is just a small hole on the bottom and the waterfall effect is so pretty. Fred is curious about it, but swims quickly away when he feels the pull. So far, so good!
customer_reviews.author: SteeleInMusic

customer_reviews.title: Gonna buy a second for a shrimp only tank.
customer_reviews.text: Super little nano tank! Three gallons is enough for our betta, mystery snail and three 1/2" shrimp. Heavy plant load, an HOB and heater and everyone's happy. Light isn't strong enough for high light demanding plants but illuminates the tank perfectly well for observation. Very attractive and c'mon, for thirty bucks you can't go wrong! *Caution*: Scrub the inside walls gently as the plastic (not plexi) can be easily scratched.
customer_reviews.author: RICK LETT

customer_reviews.title: Components are CHEAP!
customer_reviews.text: The filter is ok at best. And like other reviews, the air pump failed after a couple weeks, requiring you to buy another one. I was also missing the cover to the filter. It would have been cheaper from the beginning to buy quality parts on their own and "package" the aquarium by myself with the better parts. You are really only getting an expensive plastic tank with light bc everything else stinks. I'd return it but it has my daughters fish in it, so i guess it stays. It ends up costing over $100 for a tank to have a beta fish in it after you buy gravel, a plant, and replace the cheap parts.
customer_reviews.author: TimE R.

customer_reviews.title: Best Amazon Purchase!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing so far!!!!! This is great! My kids love it. Easy quick assembly/No directions needed. Filter is super super quiet- can't hear a thing. We have 2 goldfish in there. They don't like the light...too bright for them. But it works perfectly too. I recommend leaving the filter off for the first few days, so enough bacteria builds up to make the water good for your goldfish. As soon as I turned the filter back on on day 3, the water was so clear and bubbles dissipated--so the filter works very well too! The sunken ship and plants we bought from walmart. The rocks, fish, fish food, and fish 'tap water safe' solution we bought from a petsmart.
customer_reviews.author: Robin

customer_reviews.title: WOW, get ready for mess
customer_reviews.text: So I don't normally write reviews but i'm not happy at all. I bought two of these for my kiddos and their fish. At first, very awesome. Quite, light works, easy setup. BUT next night both were half empty. I'm like 'crap there is a leak or i forgot to do something'. NOPE. The dang filter shoots water out the back. Through the whole that the top lid comes down on. It's happened twice now. Sopping wet carpet. Which is brand new BTW. DO NOT BUY. DO NOT BUY! I'm not new to aquariums. I have two 50 gallons. These filters are really the only problem. But man does it cause damage.
customer_reviews.author: TN Hawkeye

customer_reviews.title: Awesome tank for beginners!
customer_reviews.text: There's a lot of versatile ways you can use this tank and it hold quite a bit. It's a pretty neat tank that has such a simple design and is appealing to the eye. The light it came with is standard and it works well. The filter is noisy and has then tendency to create a lot of bubbles and make a constant humming sound, however it doesn't create a strong current (and doesn't suck up my betta's fins when he goes near it). The biggest downside to the tank is that the plastic scratches really easily.
customer_reviews.author: CNicole

customer_reviews.title: Very happy
customer_reviews.text: I'm very happy with this tank and so is my betta! I had a smaller 1 gallon but I felt bad for him and upgraded to this tank. I love the cube design, and the led light really lights up the tank nicely! It makes me feel better to watch swim around with room to expand his fins. I highly recommend this tank, you can't beat the price.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Upgrade
customer_reviews.text: The Tetra LED cube kit tank is a great fit for our fancy goldfish. Now we just need to add some decor. The Tetra Whisper filter that came in the box is so quiet, and a welcomed change from our very noisy air stone. The lid isn't as stable/secure/durable as I would like, but it's not a deal breaker. I love the brightness of the LED lights!!! My biggest concern was this. . . does the filter motor AND cord SERIOUSLY go INSIDE the water???!!!! This gives me anxiety. The instructions that came with the filter were very basic and left me searching the internet for answers that I didn't find.
customer_reviews.author: Anna Finley

customer_reviews.title: Great tank for my home office! <3 it! (Doesn't come with decorations)
customer_reviews.text: I am SO in love with this tank. Be aware that it does not come with ANY of the decorations. Just the tank and base and light and filter (with it's own little air pump that runs the filter) The instructions aren't super clear but it's also not very complicated. This tank is big enough for my pleco and cory catfish. The picture is with the items I added to it. which include the following: A light bubbler;, Easter Island figure;, 5 lbs of gravel;, and an extra air pump (will only run one item so this will only handle the bubbler not the bubbler and the filter. Do be aware of that.)
customer_reviews.author: Dva

customer_reviews.title: Damaged and Part Missing
customer_reviews.text: We previously bought this product a few years ago and like it. The filter loses power overtime but works. The plastic is clear and easy to see through. We purchased a second tank this week and it came with a nickle sized chip missing from one side of the plastic tank and a crack leading further into the tank. The plastic tube connecting the filter was missing. The tank was packaged and wrapped professionally and did not appear to have been tampered with. We need the tank now for a fish in the house and we cannot return it. We'll be super gluing the crack and trying to purchase separate tubing. I'm disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Tank itself is very nice and great price. Filter it subpar.
customer_reviews.text: I love the tank in gernally, it’s a plastic material but quite sturdy. Light works well too. However I’ve been having issues with the pump after only using it for a few months. I change the filter regularly but the pump seems too be dieing. The stream of filtered water has depleated from a nice strong slow to a slow dribble. I’ve taken out the filter housing and hose to clean but after another day or so it goes back to the slow dribble. Will probably end up purchasing a more reliable filter for the tank. Disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great tank!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this tank!!! Comes with everything that you need to start and it’s very pretty. The only thing is that I bought two of these tanks and one came with a quiet filter which I loved.!!! My second tank came with a really loud annoying filter. I returned that tank and rebought the tank and it came with the quiet filter. I realized that the box says “quiet filter” so make sure that’s the one you get. TIP: If you get one with the loud filter, the same brand sells the quiet filter for $10 .so if you don’t want to go through the trouble of maybe getting the wrong filter, also order the quiet filter.
customer_reviews.author: IRA

customer_reviews.title: LEAKS!
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY! This tank leaks, we had a beta and a pleco in it with some gems on the bottom and a castle in it. I hadn’t even did a tank cleaning yet and it leaved all over when we were away for vacation. I came back to nearly dead fish and a ruined cabinet (wooden) and a broken DVD player because of all of the water that leaked out while we were gone. I am so upset with this product and now I have to go buy a new one because we still have the darn fish. Not happy.
customer_reviews.author: Bethany Wieber

customer_reviews.title: Dont buy this if you value your tank inhabitants
customer_reviews.text: Good tank for shrimp. But beware , the lid does have some pretty big gaps in it so if you have escape artist snails I definitely wouldn't buy this tank, or at least get a different cover for it. Edit: changed review from 3 stars to 1 Today I found my snail stuck to the intake on the bottom and one of his antannae missing. The filter it comes with is very dangerous and there's not a good way to cover the intake
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer #999

customer_reviews.title: Cube Aquarium fits perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for something small that would fit into a plant stand that I had in the living room. This works perfectly and is a nice added touch to the relaxing ambiance we are creating. The cover keeps the cats out and the water inside the tank. I also like that the opening for feeding is a little larger than the one on the old tank. Yet, it is not large enough that our cats could get into it. Finally, the light is a nice feature for late nights or evenings. We do not keep it on all of the time since additional light seemed to encorage extra algae growth in the old tank.
customer_reviews.author: Derick

customer_reviews.title: Injured my betta severely
customer_reviews.text: This is a good starter tank in terms of size for a betta but DON’T use the filter included. My poor betta got his fins caught in the filter included and he’s in terrible shape and I’m afraid of what may happen to him now. I bought two of these and the first filter just blew up for some reason and made a huge mess. My betta in that tank was fine but now my second tank is the one that really injured my poor betta. Buy a sponge filter before you get this tank with an air pump so you don’t have to watch your poor little guy get injured.
customer_reviews.author: Belle Lynn Allen

customer_reviews.title: Use filter with caution - it killed my Betta
customer_reviews.text: Please put a panty hose near the area of suction on your filter. I did not, and we had to wake up to find my older Betta who was starting to become list from old age dead inside of his filter. Only his tale was sticking out, as his entire body was inside of it. He essentially drowned or died of trauma. A traumatic sight to see and experience.
customer_reviews.author: Kitkate

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for one fish! Beautiful lighting!
customer_reviews.text: He's (beta) so much happier in this tank. He was previously in a 1.5. It wasn't to much of a dramatic change. I think this is the perfect size for a beta fish. Also good for decoration and live plants. I love the opening for feeding the fish. Don't give up on the filter. I read people said it was junk. Just let it run and it will work. I was worried because it was making a strange noise. I left it on and it's working like a charm now. I would definitely recommend this tank. 🐠💗
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Cheapest aquarium you can imagine.
customer_reviews.text: Wow, Tetra has sunk to new lows. I wish I had seen this review and paid a bit more for a better filter. This filter is more of a joke - just gurgles bubbles and doesn't filter much of anything. The light is ok. Bare minimum, but at least it doesn't leak. No heater of course. No stones, of course. Buy a quality aquarium for your betta or be prepared to add a better filter and heater for this beyond-cheap kit.
customer_reviews.author: Malcolm GrangerTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Still Love it
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful tank-clean carefully, it scratched-that said, not badly, as i realized it the second it happened. I just turned the tank around. I will say if you are like me and love live plants-you WII need to upgrade the lighting. The pic is this tank after a year-still beautiful, sorry it's a closeup-was getting a pic of the shrimp. Too lazy to take one just for the review as my desk is a mess and I'd have to clean it.
customer_reviews.author: Nykiridoll

customer_reviews.title: If they had thumbs, this space saving tank would get two thumbs up from Meriwether and Blucifer
customer_reviews.text: If they had thumbs, this space saving tank would get two thumbs up from Meriwether and Blucifer. Easy to clean, easy to see the fish and snail, doesn't take up much room. If you find that the little filter produces too much of a current for your betta, leave the lid flipped open. More of the water will bubble out the top instead of the front, and the current isn't as strong. Meri is happy as a clam (how do we know how happy clams are, exactly?) and fills it with bubble nests regularly.
customer_reviews.author: S. C.

customer_reviews.title: Filter was faulty.
customer_reviews.text: The tank looks nice, and we just put our betta in it today so I can't say yet how the fish likes it. However the filter we got was immediately broken upon arrival and did not work. After reading the bad reviews on here now, I guess it's a good thing we just went out and bought a different one since the one it comes it doesn't work great (according to reviews) when is is working either.
customer_reviews.author: Jun

customer_reviews.title: Filter is junk
customer_reviews.text: Filter died within less than 12 hours. How do I get a replacement filter? I do not want to undo the entire fish tank to return for a replacement. I just need the filter.
customer_reviews.author: Di

customer_reviews.title: Tank is great, the filter is not.
customer_reviews.text: I got this tank for a Betta Fish and he's loving it. The filter that comes with it however, is not strong enough to keep the water clean. My fish would actually sleep underneath it, so that should give you some indication of how weak it is. I highly recommend ditching it and getting a better one. I chose a Azoo Aquarium Mignon Filter 60 (  ) I also added a heater as Betta fish do best in water that is 78-80 degrees. (  ) Overall, my Betta is happy and active in this tank. It's small enough to keep on my kitchen counter which allows us both to happily watch each other! :)
customer_reviews.author: Alisson G.

customer_reviews.title: scratches easy and is small for most fishes
customer_reviews.text: An average product..better off buying a 5 gallon tank for you betta I have two of these and though the fish survive,, the swim space is not that much ...definitely will need a heater depending on fish type This will be tool small for gold fish and will need a heater for any tropical fish Scratched very easy ... the filter creates a lot of flow for the size and created a crater in the sand substrate ..so advice is to use gravel the lid if flimsy on one and okay on two I have bought PERFECT for juvenile betta'sa
customer_reviews.author: CZARAB

customer_reviews.title: Great tank...included filter is junk
customer_reviews.text: The tank itself is great. Trash the filter and buy a different one. I recommend the Mignon Filter 60. The filter included is loud and can hurt your betta’s fins if they get sucked into the filter. The tank and light is great though. Add a different filter and heater and you’re all set.
customer_reviews.author: A. R.

customer_reviews.title: First Bubble Nest!!
customer_reviews.text: Our "Foosh" really loves this tank! we upgraded him from a 1.6 gallon to this tank and the first couple days were a little rough because he could see his reflection in all sides but on the 3rd day he built his first bubble nest! yay! we are modifying the filter because it's too powerful. we haven't used it at all so far and our betta has been just fine. we also have a 15 watt heater under his gravel that keeps the tank at 79-80. super happy with this and so is Foosh!
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia K Resig

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful and well worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: This little aquarium is gorgeous! It arrived in flawless condition and was simple to set up. The only thing I would recommend is absolutely do not use the filter that came with it. It is insufficient. Don't let that dissuade you though because you still get a bargain even with purchasing another filter which will actually keep the tank clean and circulate the water. I bought a Penn Plax Cascade 20 and it is perfect for this aquarium. Remember too you will need to buy rocks and decorations as well. I also bought an air stone with a pump just because the bubbles look cool and are relaxing. I set this up in my work office and it looks amazing.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Perfect small tank for a betta
customer_reviews.text: My new favorite betta tank. It's got enough space for the heater and filter (I used a different filter than the one included) and the footprint is small enough to fit on my cube shelf, so my betta can hang out and watch us as we go about our day. It's still harder to maintain than a 5 gallon tank, but that's true of all small tanks. All in all, as long as you're okay with the extra maintenance required in a smaller tank, this is a great choice.
customer_reviews.author: jen86

customer_reviews.title: Great looking crystal clear cube tank
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these for my daughters’ betta fish. They had been in a tank that was quite a bit smaller and shared a wall between them. However after the second time of one of them jumping over into the others side, I knew I needed separate tanks, and something bigger. This is a great looking crystal clear cube. I followed the advice from several other reviewers and replaced the filters with better ones. I also added heaters and used clear plastic packaging to cover the larger openings on the lids. So far these tanks seem to be doing their jobs and our fish look healthy and happy.
customer_reviews.author: NCJennifer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect little tank!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect little tank for our Betta! Just set it up today and it looks great! Can’t wait to let him check out his new home! Packaged well and all the pieces were accounted for. I just had to watch a short video on how to set up filter on YouTube because instructions were a bit vague. Also, I thought it was nice that I had the option not to install LED light since I had no need for it.
customer_reviews.author: Mel P.

customer_reviews.title: CAME CRACKED STRAIGHT OUT OF THE BOX
customer_reviews.text: I would include a picture but I quickly resealed it to return it. I also seemed much more flimsy and basically a large plastic box unlike what the pictures look like (obviously decor would help). I am currently on the search for a new tank.. suggestions are welcome :) I wish everyone luck with this tank.. clearly I got a dud!
customer_reviews.author: Janice

customer_reviews.title: This is a cheap product
customer_reviews.text: This seemed like a good tank for my daughter's Betta, until she woke up one morning to half the water emptied onto her bedroom floor. Apparently one of the seals let go. Now we have carpet damage and no tank for the Betta, who is now sitting in a bowl while we try to figure out a new tank for it. Unfortunately we can't return this as we bought it February and the window for return closed in March. I think a company should warranty it's product longer than 1 month.
customer_reviews.author: Abe

customer_reviews.title: Great betta tank
customer_reviews.text: Great tank for a betta fish! It doesn't come with a heater but you can get a small betta heater at Petsmart for $10 The filter hasn't been an issue as far as current too strong or sucking our fish up or anything. We love it
customer_reviews.author: BriWycherley

customer_reviews.title: Great for a Betta!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this aquarium. The aquarium itself is one piece so I'm not at all concerned about leakage, which was a problem with my last aquarium (Top Fin 2.5 Gal Retreat, leaked the first day.) My betta seems happy and I feel better that he's in a larger enclosure than those small betta bowls. Also, the filter is gentle, which is better for the betta as they like still water better than a current. It's perfect for a betta and a couple of ghost shrimp to keep things tidy.
customer_reviews.author: OwnedByAnArabMare

customer_reviews.title: LEAKS!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I loved this at first! Had about 4 days and woke up to areain my living room being soaked!!!! I have a special needs son and he has a mattress on the floor placed so he can see the tank and when I woke up this morning his under side of hit mat and my table I had it on was drenched. No clue as to why!! Can't return because of lock down due to Covid-19.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice little tank.
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for 14 year old and he set it up just fine by himself. It is very quiet and it fits nicely on top of a bookcase. We had to buy a betta tank heater because it is just a little to big to stay warm with room temperature. Also, there is a lot of condensation on the tank lid which was a problem even before we bought the heater. This lid is essentially unusable as a way to look down into the tank. Overall it is nice little tank and the light is a nice touch. I would give 5 stars but the lid isn't a great design.
customer_reviews.author: Chad Glenn

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful
customer_reviews.text: I was afraid that a 3-gallon tank was going to be waaay to big, but this one wasn't. It is the perfect size for my Beta fish, Moonshine, and gives her much more room to swim around. The only thing I don't like is the filter that comes with it. The filter that comes with it is a 1-3 gallon and I already had a 1-4 gallon filter. the 1-3 gallon filter just isn't enough for the tank. I highly recommend buying the Tetra 1-4 gallon filter system. They both take small cartridges so its an easy switch. Other than that it is perfect!
customer_reviews.author: K Jones

customer_reviews.title: Tanks
customer_reviews.text: The filter doesn't work correctly and makes a strange glugging noise along with the buzzing noise from the air pump. I don't mind the bright light that came with it, but I will definitely either have to ask them to send me a better one that works or buy a new filter. It would be five stars except for this. Edit-Tinkered with the filter and it at least stopped the glugging noise. Now it is pretty quiet. Great tank for a starter tank.
customer_reviews.author: Mika L

customer_reviews.title: Pretty fish prison.
customer_reviews.text: Nice inexpensive tank for my daughter to kill the goldfish in style that she won at the fair. Please stop giving fish as prizes, my yard is full of tiny fish corpses.
customer_reviews.author: Lelen

customer_reviews.title: Tetra 3 gallon cube with LED light
customer_reviews.text: The 3 gallon tank is really easy to set up. I like the lid, it has openings for the heater and the filter. Three things I felt could be a little better, the filter, that came with the kit is ridiculously, the tubing kept falling out. I just used a filter I already had. Since this is a kit, I felt it should have come with a heater and a thermometer. Also the lamp is a little small. My betta, Moby Dick, seems to like the tank. The price is reasonable. I would purchase item again.
customer_reviews.author: Janet C.

customer_reviews.title: Great-looking Aquarium
customer_reviews.text: I've read the older prior reviews. I just bought this and it's a great tank, no uneven "edges," the filter pump is quiet, all lights work. My betta is very happy in it with live plants. The only thing I would recommend to Tetra is to slightly decrease the width of the filter hole about 1/2" or slightly less. Highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Cricket

customer_reviews.title: Good for what it does
customer_reviews.text: This totally does the trick. Betta is happy. You'll need to buy a heater. Filter pump is a little noisy (but they all kinda are) and the tank scratches VERY EASILY. I think I scratched the inside of mine with a toothbrush. Still, for the price? This does what it does and is very pretty. I wish the light was angled "front to back" instead of "Back to front," since it doesn't show off the fish's colors as much. Meh, whatever.
customer_reviews.author: Pen Dull

customer_reviews.title: ... the fish tank I set it all up just like the instructions say I put my fish in and ...
customer_reviews.text: So I got the fish tank I set it all up just like the instructions say I put my fish in and about an hour later he jumped out from the hole that is cut out of the lid for the filter to sit he is still alive but his fins are badly torn if you do by this Aquarium or tank make sure you adjust the lid so there are no holes to get out and cover up the feeding slot
customer_reviews.author: Felicia

customer_reviews.title: Fun little tank..... But don't scratch it!
customer_reviews.text: Great for the price, but you must be sooooo careful with acrylic. I knew it would scratch easily, yet five minutes into setup I still somehow managed to scuff the inside with a wooden spoon. I did not have any problems with the lid as others mentioned. The lid on mine sits perfectly flat and fits correctly. The light is..... Decent I suppose. It's just barely enough light for fish, possibly too little for plants. The tank definitely needs to be placed near lots of indirect natural light. PS the filter is TERRIBLE just toss that sucker and buy a real one
customer_reviews.author: wesley e.

customer_reviews.title: My betta likes it!
customer_reviews.text: The suction is a little strong but I put a plant in front and it seems to not suck up my fish. He’s learning how to avoid the thing and is strong enough to get away. My only complaint is I didn’t get all the parts to the filter, contacting the seller. Will update my opinion later. Overall a nice tank, not too big of a footprint.
customer_reviews.author: Tinytitan50

customer_reviews.title: Do not clean with anything that will scratch it, it is delicate to hard sponges or hard cleaning tools only use soft clothes
customer_reviews.text: Had it for two years and its perfect for my tiny living room in my Apt in NYC. I have a roommate and my room has a bedroom and tiny private livingroom, its like a suite so I put it in the small sitting room with lots of plants a ficus tree, its perfect, very relaxing. Like all fish tanks you must clean your tank every week and check water acids and chem tests all the time or no fish tank big or small will work. Go to a pro and ask how to set up a tank with live plants and get started. Its addictive!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great tank, CRAP FILTER.
customer_reviews.text: This aquarium is great for 1 Betta. I hate the filter that came with it though, it’s crap. It’s super loud and it bubbles. So I recommend getting another filter when you buy this because that’s filter just does not work! It’s super loud and has a weird tube thing and many parts to it! I had to tape down the filter part that is actually outside of the water hooked up through a tube because it vibrates a lot and basically would fall off of the table!
customer_reviews.author: MegMegMeg

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Betta...lid arrived cracked
customer_reviews.text: Pretty little tank perfect for my Betta. I did follow other reviewers advice and get a different filter and added a heater. Marking down as the tank was not packaged well in shipping (box was rattling around in a bigger box) and lid arrived cracked. It’s still functional but disappointing. I would return it but my Betta needed a home larger than the little cup he came in. Also the opening to feed the fish is large enough for a Betta to jump through so I have covered it. I wish this was designed differently with a door that could be opened/shut or even a little square placed over the hole
customer_reviews.author: CG

customer_reviews.title: The cube aquarium is great, but the filter that comes with it was ...
customer_reviews.text: The cube aquarium is great, but the filter that comes with it was horrible. It worked for the first week or so and then gradually slowed down to a stop. Nothing we did could make it work again including changing out the relatively brand new filter that was inside of it. Luckily we have a beta and I was told that Betas really do not like the filter running anyway. So, I won't worry about replacing it right now. The aquarium was easy to set up and our fish is happier than ever. He started making the mating bubble nests all over the top of the water for the first time since we've had him. :0)
customer_reviews.author: HK

customer_reviews.title: is very happy in his new home
customer_reviews.text: Sushi, our betta, is very happy in his new home, complete with Squidward house and Spongebob pineapple. The included pump is good for supplying oxygen, not necessarily "cleaning". About every 2 weeks, about 3/4 of the water is replaced and we run our turbo 5/10 gallon pump to clean out the yucks. Of course, Sushi is in a bowl watching this happen. Went together in a snap and has had 2 transports for fish-sitting to date. I'm thinking of getting a couple others to put in the office and another room as they are pretty modern looking and nice to look at!
customer_reviews.author: Scout Mama

customer_reviews.title: Pump is anything BUT quiet!
customer_reviews.text: The "quiet" air pump that comes with this set is VERY LOUD. It hums and rattles even when buried in foam. Very sad since we need quiet in our therapy rooms.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandria W. Zettler

customer_reviews.title: Uh-Oh my fish is dead!
customer_reviews.text: Got up this morning to find my fish stuck sideways against the filter intake and could not swim free! He was badly injured and I had to euthanize him. Need to find a way to keep fish from getting into this situation. Some say it will only happen to a sick fish, but my fish seemed very healthy. Also suggested to put a sponge with a hole in it around the intake so fish can't swim closely. Anyway, BE CAREFUL!
customer_reviews.author: Martha Ellingwood

customer_reviews.title: Good looking tank and easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: I needed a small tank to keep a betta fish separate from the other fish and this one is perfect for that purpose. It's a very nice looking design, easy to set up, with pretty lighting and big enough for 1-3 small fish. Instead of gravel, I used the Carib Sea ACS05820 Super Natural Moonlight Sand (sold separately on Amazon) which gives the tank a very clean and natural look. A few things you may consider purchasing extra: a heater, a thermometer and maybe a bubble stone with air pump, if you want bubbles. When you are looking for a small tank, this is a definitely a good choice.
customer_reviews.author: Yeska

customer_reviews.title: Cute tank! Sleek and perfect for Beta.
customer_reviews.text: I like to wait a while before writing any review so time. This Tetra 3 gallon tank was purchased by my son for his girlfriend. It was easy to set up and clean. It is plastic which is a plus since it isn't as heavy and no seams to possibly start to leak. The light is powerful and water filtering through with enough pressure with out sucking up the Beta. His girlfriend and her fish are quite happy and my son won major brownie points! We have several other tanks at home and are considering acquiring a few more for other children and as gifts.
customer_reviews.author: christine

customer_reviews.title: Looks nice, but filter somehow leaked all over my desk.
customer_reviews.text: This tank was awesome for a little while! The filter kept it sparkling clean for weeks at a time. It’s bulky, but I could tell my betta loved having a few gallons of space. Yesterday, however, I sat down at my desk only to find my desk surface covered in water. The filter somehow leaked all over the place. Fortunately, none of my stuff (including my laptop) was damaged, but I can’t risk that happening again. I’m moving on to a new 3-gallon aquarium from a different company.
customer_reviews.author: Lady Geranium

customer_reviews.title: Tank awesome, filter rubbish
customer_reviews.text: My beta Gilligan loves this tank! I upgraded from a smaller tank and he's so much happier in here. The filter is junk (which I expected from other reviews) and broke within a couple months. Probably good as it encouraged me to buy a better filter. I bought this along with a floating log which my fish loves. you can find that here:  This tank looks great and is a great size. Don't expect the filter to do anything but the tank on it's own warrants the 5 stars
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Great looking tank! Love it
customer_reviews.text: I received this tank today and set it up for my betta. So far I’m very happy with it, it’s a great size and looks awesome all set up. I was a little worried about getting a tank that’s not glass, but it looks really good. The light it comes with is nice, the glow it creates in the tank is really pretty. I would have given 5 stars, but the filter pump it came with makes a strange sound kind of like static. I’m sure it’s not normal for these filters, I have either the same filter or a very similar one on my other tank and it doesn’t do that. I may just need to adjust something.
customer_reviews.author: Pickles

customer_reviews.title: Loving This Tank!
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure if this 3 gallon tank would be large enough for a betta. I've used 5 gallon ones in the past. This tank, in my opinion, is a perfect size. I substituted a sponge filter for the filter that came with it. I had no complaints about the filter that came with the kit. I just prefer sponge filters for bettas. I've added plants, and I've kept the environment minimalist to give my future betta fish more room to swim around. I love the way this tank looks more than any other tank I've had. In time, I will buy more of these and house all my bettas in them. I'm loving this tank!
customer_reviews.author: olderman

customer_reviews.title: killed my fish
customer_reviews.text: this tank sucks, my betta fish mastercheif lived in an unfiltered bowl for 3 weeks which u washed regularly but the day i transferred him into here i went to bed and he was dead the next morning sucked into the filter, it was a betta fish so it wasnt tiny, this is a horrible home for your fish it will just kill it.
customer_reviews.author: Gavin ODonnell

customer_reviews.title: Fun project tank for nursery
customer_reviews.text: Decent little starter kit for a teacher's desk or a class project. However, it needs to be cleaned frequently - about every 3 - 4 days. Holiday breaks could go sideways. The little tetra 50w heater works well as an add-on purchase if you are looking at tropical fish. Feeder guppies and snails have thrived. Ghost shrimp managed to jump out even with the lid, or they got stuck to the lid and dried out overnight. I'm going to try a beta when the guppies need moved to a bigger tank.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Koehler

customer_reviews.title: Nice aquarium starter kit
customer_reviews.text: This is a good starter set for a betta. My betta seems to be happy with the 3 gallons of water. I really think that a 10 or 20 gallon tank is little extreme. You're going to have to purchase accessories to treat the water, bacteria to consume the food waste, and water testing strips to make sure the water chemistry is right. They are not included in the kit.
customer_reviews.author: D. Wieneke

customer_reviews.title: Lovely tank
customer_reviews.text: Nice tank, I recently upgraded my betta’s fish tank to this one and he’s really loving it! He’s discovering his new tank and seems to enjoy it. The only thing is that there is a really big whole where the filter is supposed to go and is very dangerous. Another thing is since my fish likes to swim in the front of the tank the light doesn’t really shine as much in that area. Overall it is a really good tank and I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Elsa

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: It arrives with a scratch/ crack on the bottom as you can see in the pictures. Also the lid will not close! Will not stay on! The right corner of the lid it’s bent out of shape as you can see in the pictures. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: cristian

customer_reviews.title: Really Nice Tank
customer_reviews.text: I recently had the 1.5 gallon version of this tank and loved it, but my betta needed more room. This tank is perfect. It's the perfect size (even though a betta technically needs 5 gallons) and lets my betta explore more than before. However, the "whisper" filter it comes with is nice; it's just louder than the previous one. Overall, this tank is awesome; might just need to upgrade the filter in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Mason Gaskins

customer_reviews.title: Great for beta fish
customer_reviews.text: We have a single beta fish in this tank and he loves it. While not advisable to keep any fish in less than a 5 gallon tank, this tank works good for a beta fish. Please, if you have a beta fish, do not keep them in a bowl or vase without filtration.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a Betta
customer_reviews.text: a very nice aquarium. I've just one Betta in it and it is perfect... large enough to be able to move things around often for Betta entertainment and nice looking too. I'm taking care to only pour out my gravel from the backside of the tank. It is acrylic and will scratch.
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my betta!
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 of these, both purchased on Amazon and I love them! The first one I ordered has been running smoothly for 3 months now and I liked it so much that I got a second. It is easy to set up and very decorative. I have one on a nightstand and the other on a counter top. It's also the perfect size for a desk. The filter isn't particularly exciting, but the flow is nice and gentle for a betta. The light has held up so far and provides good visibility.
customer_reviews.author: spt vet

customer_reviews.title: Great tank for the price—filter silent as promised
customer_reviews.text: This is a great small tank. I got it for my shrimp (and I keep some fry from my big tank in there as well). The filter is noiseless. You can only hear it with your ear against the tank. And I love the shape of the tank—it looks modern and more expensive than it is. The only thing that’s less good is the light. I wish it was a bit brighter, and would be the only thing I’d upgrade (especially if you want a lot of plants).
customer_reviews.author: Sara Baicker-McKee

customer_reviews.title: Nice little tank
customer_reviews.text: This is a great starter tank. I needed to move my betta into something a bit bigger. This tank is good for one fish. Maybe a few small tank mates like ghost shrimp or bottom feeder. It is plastic. I thought it was going to be a bit more substantial for the price I paid, but it works. I will be purchasing a different filter for it. I don't like the sound of the pump that came with this one. Maybe look around for a cheaper price on this tank. A sale somewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Happy beta
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for our beta. Added a bunch of live plants, heater and different substrate. I liked this model because it was *not glass and easy to move outside when there are nice days (Florida Lanai for best fish views). Looks sharp. Pump is not loud at all. So far so good for over a month.
customer_reviews.author: sabajoe

customer_reviews.title: Nice bright light, easy to clean and great looking
customer_reviews.text: This is a great aquarium. I was worried the plastic would not be very sturdy but it is very thick and I'm not worried that the weight of the water will have any effect on it. The led light is nice and bright and makes colorful decorations pop. I like that the base snaps off easily for cleaning. Everything I've read says that this is the absolute smallest tank you should buy for a single Betta fish.
customer_reviews.author: jus10averageconsumer

customer_reviews.title: nice but...
customer_reviews.text: The tank is very nice great size for one betta however I really liked the idea of having a temperature gauge on the outside o the tank but I doesn't work. This was one of the reasons I bought the tank, it was one less thing I would have had to purchase. Would have honored 5 stars if it worked.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great shape, I really like the look of it
customer_reviews.text: Great shape, I really like the look of it. The ONLY reason I'm not giving a five star review is because... if you happen to fill it up at your sink and then go to carry it elsewhere... the sides are so wobbly it seems like any second the whole thing is going to break open and spill 3-gallons of water straight onto the floor. So... slow and steady if you need to use a sink. Otherwise, fill it where it will sit! But - I like it. So does my betta, Senor Frio. :)
customer_reviews.author: N. Gramlich

customer_reviews.title: Horrible aquarium! Leaks!
customer_reviews.text: Terrible product! Do not buy. The filter doesn’t produce enough flow to create any oxygen bubbles in the water for the fish to breath, so you have to add a air pump. Filter clogs within a day and water rolled off the back of the filter and out of the tank, down the dresser that the tank sets on in our boys’ room, and through the hardwood floor, and onto the ceiling below their bedroom. What a horrible design!!! Do NOT BUY. Will try to return, but already through the box away.
customer_reviews.author: C.T

customer_reviews.title: Filter is junk!
customer_reviews.text: Like most of the reviews mentioned. The tank itself works fine and it's ok, but the filter that comes with it is awful! The first 12hrs it worked great, the slowly it got louder and louder. We have set it up in our kitchen and our bedrooms are upstairs and at night you could hear it. After 2 nights, my husband unplugged it and we got another filter.
customer_reviews.author: NMirz

customer_reviews.title: Purchased 01-2014- Pump failed 06-2015
customer_reviews.text: We have had one beta fish in this tank since we purchased it in 2014. (Fish still lives). The pump TOTALLY failed in June. It started failing in May and we were able to rig it up to work by tilting it a bit. Three stars for loving the design, and its pretty easy to move and clean, but if the pump is going to fail, then you are really paying 40 bucks for a plastic cube with a light. I considered buying another of the same tank, but not if the main point of the tank (pump and filter) will fail in 1-2 years. Strongly support other reviews that say the pump fails within 1-2 years.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Rudnicki

customer_reviews.title: Invest in a glass tank, it'll save you money long term!
customer_reviews.text: Just spend the extra money and get a glass aquarium! This tank scratches so easily, all the tiny scratches make it look cloudy. It's just not a clean look, I'm tempted spend $60 more and upgrade to a glass marineland 5 gallon. At least it holds water 😂
customer_reviews.author: Dan or Jeriee Green

customer_reviews.title: Small size limits animal compatibility but this is a great little tank.
customer_reviews.text: Small size limits animal compatibility but this is a great little tank for some shrimp and snails or a Betta. Planted it works great also with supplemental ambient light from room. Plants that require more light will need an upgraded lamp on this tank. Filter seems adequate for size. Replacement filters are easy to find. Tank seems to stay pretty cool by itself so I picked up a 50watt header and it stays perfect with that.
customer_reviews.author: D D

customer_reviews.title: LIGHT BROKE IN 48 HOURS FILTER IS NOT DOING WELL EITHER
customer_reviews.text: The light stopped working within 48 hours of the tank being set up and I only turned it on for few hours both days! The filter is not doing well already either. I am ordering a separate sponge filter for the tank in itself but I'm more annoyed at the light. The filter is fixable the light is not. I will not get this again unless somehow I can find a working light for the tank.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: lasted just over 6 months before leaking
customer_reviews.text: This tank started leaking from the bottom after just over 6 months. All of the fish died, my daughter is horrified and the flooring is ruined. Spend a little bit more and get glass instead of this cheap plastic.
customer_reviews.author: R. Meyer

customer_reviews.title: Im happy with it
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with the tank! Its a very nice tank for the price. I shopped around and this tank set was the best price for what you get. It was easy to set up. It comes with a clip on filter and a light. The tank is made out of a thick plastic. The filter works well and the light is a nice light, not cheaply made. The instructions call for about 5 to 6 pounds of gravel. You will just need to purchase additional filters. I definitely recommed buying it!
customer_reviews.author: Sonrisa

customer_reviews.title: Leaks
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this product a few months ago. First impression was the tank itself was a bit flimsy. However, worked great for the first couple months. We noticed the water slowly decreasing and assumed it was evaporating. Turns out it was leaking. Over time it seemed through the wood on the bookshelf it was on. This morning the shelf buckled causing the tank to fall. Now I am out a fish tank and a bookshelf. Luckily the fish survived. My daughters would have been devastated. Not sure if it’s manufactured defect but I would not recommend the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Ratiu

customer_reviews.title: Sleek and functional
customer_reviews.text: My betta is living large and in charge in his tank. Im no professional betta trainer, but I have filled my tank with lots of live plants and all is well. I have not had issues with the filter or light so far! I love the design. It looks sleek and you can observe from all angles.
customer_reviews.author: Emma Horoszczak

customer_reviews.title: 10L Plastic Aquarium, Terrible filter and lights
customer_reviews.text: Aquarium is nice and small, design is completely what I was looking for, BUT every additional part of provided equipment ( Filter and lights) worked 1 day in total! I left the lights and filter in the morning and already in the evening they both didn’t work! I was buying this aquarium only because of price with provided equipment. You can find cheaper GLASS aquarium on Amazon. So in the end I bought 10 Liters Plastic aquarium for 35$. I texted the suppliers and didn’t get any response for more than one week! And Amazon support didn’t provide any other details of supplier! Dissatisfied!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Depends on the fish you want
customer_reviews.text: If your fish love cold water or have a mini heater. It's pretty cool. For betas, it can be a matter of if. Mine seems to do pretty well. Got one of them little brick heaters wedged in a corner so there's still plenty of space Filter is pretty quiet. The power block thing vibrates on hard surfaces kinda loudly. Put a small kitchen cloth on it....problem solved for me at least
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good small tank
customer_reviews.text: This is a cheap and decent tank for a betta, although it is on the small side. I bought the Azoo Mignon filter and Tetra 50W heater and kept the LED lights that came with this tank. I was concerned about water quality in such a small tank, but have been checking the water parameters and the tank does seem to be cycled properly. I’ve had this tank for about 2 months and my betta seems healthy and happy and his plants are doing well. This was a good purchase, especially for the sale price I paid.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good beginner tank
customer_reviews.text: 3 gallons is a perfect size for a starter Betta tank. The included filter cartridge isn't great, but it's easy to replace with a bio bag. The cover was cracked when the item arrived, but it's only a cosmetic flaw, otherwise it was in good condition. My Betta seems happy and healthy.
customer_reviews.author: J. Park

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for what I needed it for, great for guppy fry!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best fry tank I have ever used, it is perfect for my guppy fry becuase the filter and pump aren't too strong don't have to worry about them being sucked up. However when I bought this product for only 30$, but now it is listed as a 50$ tank? Buyers beware as there is some price fluctuation. Overall this tank is great quality even though it is plastic, which I actually prefer as it is lighter, led lights are strong, and it's design is very pleasing to the eye.
customer_reviews.author: AARON MCCANN

customer_reviews.title: A great starter tank for a simple fish
customer_reviews.text: You get what you get with plastic and being $35. Nothing more and nothing less. A great starter tank for a simple fish. Wouldn’t recommend for betta because you’ll still need to do 2-3 25% water changes every week. But a good starter none the less if you want fast and cheap. The LEDS I just packed away as my betta didn’t like it, and the filter is extremely loud with humming and it sucks that you’d have to keep buying filter cartridges. Not good on cost or being environmentally friendly.
customer_reviews.author: Rose_Quartz_Moon

customer_reviews.title: Quiet and sleek
customer_reviews.text: The whisper filter really is a whisper. I have this tank in my bedroom and I don’t hear it at all at night when trying to sleep. Also a great starter tank as it’s easy to put together, and lightweight. Definitely worth it for a small fish!
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend especially for a betta
customer_reviews.text: I had a 1.5 bowl, didn't know any better. Everything was good till the colder weather came along and violet was not active, did some reading and learned bettas like it warm, I added the heater.. He's so much more happier with this tank. Very active and when it's feeding time, omg he's making a splash.. Only down fall is the moisture that gathers in the lid. Not much room for a lot but he loves the live plant and resting leaf.. And if I don't cover the feeding hole my cat uses it as his water bowl, LoL.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice little tank.
customer_reviews.text: Setup was a breeze. I only have two goldfish but the tank works great for that purpose. Nice and sparkling clean after several months. I made mistake of not operating the filter 24/7 and the water was cloudy. Ran it full time and it cleared right up.
customer_reviews.author: Some middle aged dude

customer_reviews.title: Yes the filter is terrible!  Replace it and this tank is great
customer_reviews.text: Tank is nice, looks great in the kitchen, fits on the counter, under the cabinets nicely. One star knocked of because as other reviewers have said- the filter is awful! If is SO loud and would vibrate and rattle all over the place. Finally, we upgraded the filter to the xsmall Aqueon. And it’s been awesome. This 3 gallon tank is home to one fin tail goldfish. She seems very happy in there!
customer_reviews.author: Thumbshopper

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Looks nice but the included air pump is far too loud and the filter bubbles excessively and does a poor job of filtering the water. I replaced the included air pump with a Mylivell air pump which is nearly silent. I will be replacing the included filter with a simple sponge filter/air stone setup, which will hopefully do a better job of filtering the water.
customer_reviews.author: Cody

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful tank, filter no bueno.
customer_reviews.text: I love this tank. Perfect for my baby betta. He has a lot of room to swim...he goes everywhere. My only complaint is the filter. Its not strong enough and the air pump seems to die on power which affect the water intake or bubbles. Sometimes I notice the outake is weak and seems to do nothing. So I eventually bought a mini internal filter. Would I buy another one? Yes.
customer_reviews.author: Ollie

product_meta.title: Tetra GloFish 3 Gallon Aquarium Kit Fish Tank with LED Lighting and Filtration Included
product_meta.description: Pattern Name:Cube Shaped| Size:10 D x 10 W x 10.512 H inchesThe Tetra Cube Aquarium Kit is the perfect starter aquarium for kitchens, dormitories, classrooms, and offices. The 3-gallon kit fits almost anywhere! The sleek and seamless tank is as transparent as glass and provides a unique and exciting panoramic view of your personal underwater habitat. The kit is equipped with a Tetra 3i filter to keep your tank clean and provide a perfect environment for your fish. The tank also features an LED light and a convenient feeding hole. You can count on the Tetra Aquarium Kits to be safe and reliable for years of enjoyment. The aquarium and cover are made of a clear plastic that resists cracking or shattering. Sign up for TetraCare to help you be more successful in your fish keeping endeavor. This is a free program with the purchase of these aquarium systems and provides on-line and over the phone support. Once you register, you'll receive specially timed e-mails to guide you through the first six months of your aquarium experience and beyond. Free direct access to our TetraCare Team is just a phone call away
feature_bullets: Equipped with a Tetra 3i filter to keep your tank clean and provide a perfect environment for small tropical fish.
The tank features an LED light to show off your fish
Lid features a convenient feeding hole. Material : Glass and acrylic
Perfect for small tropical fish, goldfish or betta.
Equipped with a Tetra 3i filter to keep your tank clean and provide a perfect environment for small tropical fish
The tank features an LED light to highlight your fish
The lid features a convenient feeding hole
For small tropical fish, goldfish, or a betta

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.
specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
